jarvis_projects.description: The project is meant to monitor each node of the server by recording their hardware specifications as well as their resource usage (e.g. CPU/Memory) in real-time. The collected data is then stored in an RDBMS database. This database is meant to be used by the LCA team (Jarvis Cluster Administration) to generate reports for future resource planning purposes (e.g. add/remove servers).
jarvis_projects.name: Cluster Monitor

summary: My name is Francois Lippe and I am a Bishop's University graduate in Computer Science. My last job was with BRP as a web integrator. Before that, I was a service desk technician for CGI. Since a very young age, I have always been curious about how technology works. I have always been in constant contact with it (video games, computers, phones, etc). When I got older, I decided to study computer science to learn everything I could about the world of technology.
